document.discussion_title: China alumina prices rise quickly, import window may soon re-open
document.topic_text: Home China alumina prices rise quickly, import window may soon re-open China’s alumina prices rose sharply last week amid tightened supply, while rising aluminium prices have also prompted refineries to lift prices. China’s interest in imported alumina may revive soon if local alumina prices keep climbing in coming weeks, market participants said. On Friday August 19, alumina was trading 1,850-1,900 yuan ($277-285) per tonne, compared with 1,700-1,750 yuan in the previous week. Reduction in output at one of China's biggest refiners was cited as a trigger for the rise in domestic alumina prices.
